Load a graph from a KGX-formatted .tar.gz file.

Source: R/load_kgx.R
load_kgx.Rd

Given a KGX-formatted tabular KG (see https://github.com/biolink/kgx/blob/master/specification/kgx-format.md) loads it as a graph.

load_kgx(filename, attach_engine = NULL, ...)

Arguments

filename

File to the graph from. Must end in .tar.gz and conform to KGX specification (see description).

attach_engine

An engine to attach to the graph (optional).

...

Other parameters (unused)

Value

A tbl_kgx graph.

Examples

phenos <- monarch_engine() |>
          fetch_nodes(query_ids = "MONDO:0007525") |>
          expand(predicates = "biolink:has_phenotype",
                 categories = "biolink:PhenotypicFeature")
#> Fetching; counting matching nodes... 
#>  total: 1.
#> Fetching; fetched 1 of 1
#> Expanding; counting matching edges... 
#>  total: 48.
#> Expanding; fetched 48 of 48 edges.

save_kgx(phenos, "phenos.tar.gz")

# when loading the graph, we can optionally attach an engine
loaded_phenos <- load_kgx("phenos.tar.gz", attach_engine = monarch_engine())

loaded_phenos
#> # A tbl_graph: 49 nodes and 48 edges
